game

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends java.lang.Object
    Frame holds the 7 tiles each player has in their possession.
    Author:
    Katarina Cvetkovic, 18347921, Tee Chee Guan, 18202044, Rajit Banerjee, 18202817 Team 15: DarkMode

      • Frame

        public Frame(Pool pool)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new player frame.
        Parameters:
        pool - the pool from which the frame draws tiles
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if pool object is null

      • contains

        public boolean contains(char letter)
        Check if a letter is found in the frame.
        Parameters:
        letter - the letter that is being searched
        Returns:
        true if letter is inside frame

      • exchange

        public java.lang.String exchange(java.lang.String letters)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Exchanges the given letters in the frame from the pool.
        Parameters:
        letters - to be exchanged e.g. "BCDE", "PA-T"
        Returns:
        the newly drawn tiles from the pool
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if there are insufficient tiles in the pool

      • getTile

        public Tile getTile(char letter)
             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Accessor for letters in the frame.
        Parameters:
        letter - chosen by user to specify the selected tile from the frame
        Returns:
        the tile object for the given letter in frame
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if required letter is not in frame

             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the Tile at given index
        Throws:

      • isEmpty

        Check if frame is empty.
        Returns:

      • refillFrame

        public java.lang.String refillFrame()
                             throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Refills the frame if it has less than 7 tiles.
        Returns:
        the String of newly drawn tiles from the pool
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if pool is empty, frame cannot be refilled

            throws java.util.NoSuchElementException

        Parameters:
        letter - to be removed from the frame
        Throws:
